alert.note: Alert for Alpine; Mono (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 04 at 3:37PM PDT until August 04 at 5:45PM PDT by NWS Reno
info.description: The National Weather Service in Reno has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... The Tamarack burn scar in... Alpine County in northern California... Northern Mono County in northern California... Douglas County in western Nevada... * Until 545 PM PDT. * At 337 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain over the Tamarack Burn Scar. Between 0.8 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. The expected rainfall rate is 0.6 to 0.75 inches in 15 minutes. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Excessive rainfall over the burn scar will result in debris flow moving through the Tamarack. The debris flow can consist of rock, mud, vegetation and other loose materials. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms in and around the Tamarack Burn Scar. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flooding of areas in and around the Tamarack Burn Scar. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Alpine Village, Grover Hot Springs, Mesa Vista, Alpine County Airport, Indian Creek Reservoir, Indian Creek Campground, Turtle Rock Campground, Markleeville and Holbrook Junction. CA Highway 89 between Woodfords and CA Highway 4, and US Highway 395 north of Topaz to Double Spring. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...0.6-0.75 INCHES IN 15 MINUTES
info.instruction: This is a life threatening situation. Heavy rainfall will cause extensive and severe flash flooding of creeks...streams...and ditches in the Tamarack Burn Scar. Severe debris flows can also be anticipated across roads. Roads and driveways may be washed away in places. If you encounter flood waters...climb to safety. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
